統合生命医科学研究センター　粘膜免疫研究チーム
(チームリーダー: FAGARASAN Sidonia )

Research Field:
The Center for Integrative Medical Sciences (IMS), a research center within the Institute for Physical and Chemical Research (RIKEN), Japan’s foremost basic research organization, invites applications for two research positions within the Laboratory for Mucosal Immunity lead by Dr. Sidonia Fagarasan.

The general goal of this laboratory is to elucidate the molecular mechanisms behind IgA predominance in the gut, to characterize cellular interactions responsible for immune tolerance in the intestinal mucosa, and to understand commensal host-bacterial relationships in the gut.
Specific lines of investigation include:

1. elucidating the role of IgA cells in maintenance of the gut homeostasis;
2. studying the functional properties of IgAs in regulating microbial communities in the gut;
3. elucidating the effects of commensal bacteria on immune functions and postnatal development of gut-associated lymphoid tissues
4. elucidating the effects of commensal bacteria on other major host physiology systems of the body

For further information about the research focus of the laboratory:
http://www.riken.jp/en/research/labs/ims/mucos_immun/
